page.title: 09VISITORS TO EAST MERSEA
page.content: In a survey of visitors to the Cudmore Grove Country Park,98% of those interviewed were walking their dog.The other people came to look at wildlife.Most of the people interviewed were local and found it easy to get to the country park.Others thought it could be better sign-posted.The sign-posts do not at present name it as a Country Park.Some people also complained about the general condition of the roads. From the interviews a number of improvements were suggested: 1 The access road could be asphalted. 2 More refreshment facilities were needed. 3 A childrens play area would encourage families to come to the park 4 Warning signs were required on the cliffs. 5 The park should be enlarged.
